name: readline
summary: Interactive line editing with history, completion, and Emacs/vi key bindings.
use_when: User wants interactive command-line input with editing
User needs command history with up/down arrow navigation
User wants line editing with backspace, home/end, etc.
User needs to save/load command history to file
avoid_when: User wants simple one-line input without editing (use fgets/read_line)
User wants GUI input (use sdl or glfw)
User wants terminal UI with cursor positioning (use ncurses)

system.notes: macOS includes libedit with readline compatibility by default
